resources.string: I am primarily a student at University of California, San Diego. This does not give me much time during the school year to gain any relevant working experience. That being said, I have worked during the summers during my college career to develop my software development skills.

As the C++ Instructor, I was responsible for teaching groups of 6-8 students the basics of C++. This required an extensive knowledge of the language in order to handle any questions about it. The course primarily focused on the principles of object oriented programming.
Expected Graduation Date 2018. \nBachelor of Science in Mathematics/Computer Science. \nGPA: 3.2

Advanced Data Structures
Software Engineering
Design and Analysis of Algorithms
Object Oriented Programming: Java
Software Tools and Techniques
Computer Organization and Systems Programming
Triton Athletic Council Representative\nNCAA Div 1 Fencing Team Member\nJunior Olympic Competitor 2011, 2012, 2013
Sound and Display Technician at Evergreen Valley United Methodist Church

Software that implements a SkipList to keep track of the players in a game of TritonTag. Used by the UC San Diego Athletic Department for official games of TritonTag for over 500 people. For more information, see the code on Github by hitting the button.
App that functions as a supplement to Pokemon GO. A modified calculator to keep track of evolving pidgeys. For more information, see the code on Github by hitting the button.
